column4: ok..so after connecting a kvm switch, i cannot get back to my native resolution 1280x1024. when i try running xfix from recovery, it only sets up the keyboard. please help me

ok..so after connecting a kvm switch, i cannot get back to my native resolution 1280x1024. when i try running xfix from recovery, it only sets up the keyboard. please help me. im 19 year old blonde female.
I like brunettes but I'll help anyway.
That is if oubackwifi: is having trouble
What exactly is the issue?  Are you trying to get a resolution higher than the ones offered in the GUI?
yes. before the kvm i had 1280 by 1024.
and it seems configuring xorg only sets up my keyboard
Try "xrandr --fb 1280x1024"
that made my wallpaper bigger, thats it
Also, I learned a little trick.  Make sure your KVM is set to your monitor when you boot your system.  If the kvm is set to a different monitor than X11 will see that monitor when probing.
yes ive done that
Try running Xorg -configure
ive already done that
Xorg is so advanced now that you don't have to have an xorg.conf at all.  If you don't have one than X simply looks at the info it probed from your hardware.
If you add things to xorg.conf though it will pay attention to them over the probing info.
Could you pastebin your xorg.conf file for me?
Or just say if it is blank
http://pastebin.com/f5de7b683
Ok good.  That is a typical one.  It hold basically no information but it is a skeleton to add configurations to.  Take a look at this: http://www.freebsd.org/doc/en/books/handbook/x-config.html
ha ha ha
